strings.Value: "Why would the Swordlords care about Varnhold?"
"What do we know of Varnhold?"

"And why should I drop everything and rush to help the Swordlords? I suppose that question would be better addressed to Lady Aldori. Prepare the letter and send it immediately — I won't let some Restovic upstarts tell me what to do, as if I were some servant."
"Varnhold isn't far off. We should find out what happened there before the same fate befalls us too."
"What do you think has happened to Varnhold?"
"Maybe Varn simply decided to stop dealing with Restov?"

"Your Grace, we have urgent news from Jamandi Aldori! The Swordlord is asking for aid with an unusual problem. Here is {g|JamandiVarnholdTrouble}her letter{/g} — please read it when you have a moment."

"Greetings, Your Grace. I have {g|JamandiVarnholdTrouble}an urgent message{/g} from Jamandi Aldori. It seems the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} have — again — proved their inability to rule their subjects. See for yourself — here's the message from Jamandi."

"I bring tidings in good measure — and bad. As for the good, it seems the {g|Restov}Restov{/g} Swordlord Jamandi Aldori honors us with her attention. She jotted you {g|JamandiVarnholdTrouble}a nice little letter{/g}. The bad tidings? She wants us to prove ourselves worthy of such recognition."

"She writes that a while ago she stopped receiving reports from {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} — a neighboring barony, established by the Swordlords' protege, {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d}. But it is not only letters that stopped coming — trade caravans, couriers, all traffic from Varnhold has ceased. It is as if the barony has disappeared."
"Jamandi Aldori expects your help with this matter, for she knows of your good relations with Maegar. She asks you to go to {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} and find out why they have fallen silent."

"Jamandi Aldori seeks allies with anyone who has proven to be trustworthy — even if only a little. Considering that {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} is the closest thing to an outpost on the east edge of the {g|River Kingdoms}River Kingdoms{/g}, it's also useful to her in keeping an eye on {g|Dunsward}Dunsward{/g} and the surrounding area."
"I appreciate your determination in solving diplomatic issues — though, in my opinion, you may wish to massage your wording somewhat. I'll send the letter to {g|Restov}Restov{/g} immediately."
"This barony is much alike your own. It was also established by a mercenary, {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d}. He got his title at the same event you did."
"Then it's time to gather a party and head to {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}, Your Grace."

"{d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d} is third or fourth son in the family, so he couldn't claim his father's inheritance. Looks like he hoped to establish a settlement of his own and gain wealth and prosperity that way."

"Hmmm... a riot? A rebellion? But if that were the case, there would be refugees. Whatever happened there, it must have been sudden indeed — perhaps a bandit attack, barbarians, a plague… whatever it was, no one outside {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} seems to know what happened."
"Judging by Aldori's letter, the silence doesn't seem voluntary. Otherwise at least one person would have reached a neighbor and spoken about what had happened there."
"You really know how to talk to those insolent {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g}! I'll just go ahead and add some lines of my own to your letter."

"How dare you, {mf|baron|baroness}?! You owe much to Lady Jamandi, yet you repay her with insults? Fine, I'll compose the letter, though I'll use milder expressions — as for you, you should go and solve the mystery of {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}!"

"Lady Aldori asks you to head to {g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g} at once — it's a barony led by {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d}, a brave soul who carved out the settlement from the wilderness. Until recently he eagerly... and frequently... relayed to the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} his many successes, but then the letters suddenly ceased. As you may expect, this is a matter of some concern!"

"Remember that annoying {d|Varn}Maegar Varn{/d}, who couldn't stop pestering you? Seems like he grew tired of Aldori's leash, so he stopped answering the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g}' letters. But Varn alone wouldn't raise so much concern — according to the letter, the settlement itself seems to have vanished!"
